alert.note: Alert for Fountain; Parke; Vermillion; Warren (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 28 at 12:57PM EST until February 03 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers and locations in Indiana...Illinois... White River at Petersburg. Wabash River at Clinton, Terre Haute, Riverton, Hutsonville Legacy Power Plant Site, Covington, Montezuma, and Lafayette. .Lowland flooding continues along much of the Wabash River, from Lafayette down to Riverton. There is potential for flooding to develop later in the week at Vincennes and Mount Carmel. The crest is past Lafayette and should reach Covington by mid-morning Monday. The river is rising at all locations downstream. Flooding may last as long as Tuesday, February 6. Lowland flooding is either expected to develop, or may develop, on the lower White River by Monday night from about Edwardsport downstream to the Hazleton area. Flooding could last as long as Wednesday afternoon. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Wabash River at Covington. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Flood water is at critical height for most agricultural levees. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:45 AM EST Sunday the stage was 21.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:45 AM EST Sunday was 21.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.1 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Monday afternoon by around 200 PM EST /100 PM CST/.
